text:
Hubl is based off jinja so thereâ€™s a small chance this will work

<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39047657/base64-decode-string-in-jinja/39047772>
You could submit a feature request in <https://github.com/HubSpot/jinjava>
The fix is out for this now

How can I inspect hubl variables? With inspecting I mean displaying all the data of the object(s) stored inside.
pprint is only displaying some information
console.log("{{ my_tags|escapejson }}") is just giving an array of names but I cannot inspect the objects.
Is there some addon I need to install or some kind of way to find out how the objects are organized?
For example I know that I can use .slug and .name on it but there should be more
Thank you for your help
A new version of Jinjava has been released to maven central <https://search.maven.org/artifact/com.HubSpot.jinjava/jinjava/2.5.10/jar>
